name: Château Margaux
about: First Growth (Premier Grand Cru Classé) producing elegant, refined wines with silky texture and perfumed aromatics.
description: First Growth (Premier Grand Cru Classé) producing elegant, refined wines with silky texture and perfumed aromatics.
tastingNotes: Violets, blackcurrant, cedar, graphite, tobacco, subtle oak spice, refined tannins with extraordinary length
pairings: Rack of lamb with herb crust
history: Established 12th century, classified First Growth 1855. Mentzelopoulos family ownership since 1977 restored legendary status.
servingRecommendation: Decant 2-4 hours for young vintages. Serve at 16-18°C in large Bordeaux glasses.

name: Château Lafite Rothschild
about: First Growth renowned for elegance, finesse, and longevity. Cabernet Sauvignon dominant with exceptional aging potential.
description: First Growth renowned for elegance, finesse, and longevity. Cabernet Sauvignon dominant with exceptional aging potential.
tastingNotes: Pencil shavings, lead, cassis, violets, cedar, cigar box, truffle notes with age
history: Rothschild family ownership since 1868. One of the most collected wines globally.
servingRecommendation: Decant 3-5 hours for young vintages. Serve at 17-18°C. Allow 15+ years aging.

name: Château Latour
about: First Growth known for powerful, structured wines with remarkable consistency. The most masculine First Growth.
description: First Growth known for powerful, structured wines with remarkable consistency. The most masculine First Growth.
tastingNotes: Blackcurrant, walnut, leather, tobacco, earth, mineral, cedar, powerful refined tannins
history: Iconic tower dates to 14th century. Exceptional quality even in challenging vintages.
servingRecommendation: Decant 4-6 hours minimum. Serve at 17-18°C. Best after 20+ years.

name: Château Mouton Rothschild
about: First Growth elevated from Second Growth in 1973. Famous for artist-designed labels and opulent style.
description: First Growth elevated from Second Growth in 1973. Famous for artist-designed labels and opulent style.
tastingNotes: Blackcurrant, cassis, mint, coffee, cedar, spice box, mocha, rich voluptuous palate
history: Baron Philippe de Rothschild's vision. Since 1945, each vintage features original artwork by Picasso, Chagall, Warhol, etc.
servingRecommendation: Decant 2-4 hours. Serve at 17-18°C. More approachable young than other First Growths.

name: Château Haut-Brion
about: First Growth and only estate outside Médoc classified in 1855. Distinctive earthy, smoky Graves character.
description: First Growth and only estate outside Médoc classified in 1855. Distinctive earthy, smoky Graves character.
tastingNotes: Smoke, tobacco, minerals, dark fruits, leather, truffle, subtle earthiness, silk-like texture
history: Oldest First Growth, established 1533. Samuel Pepys recorded drinking 'Ho Bryan' in 1663. Dillon family since 1935.
servingRecommendation: Decant 2-3 hours. Serve at 16-18°C. More accessible young than Médoc First Growths.

name: Château Cheval Blanc
about: Premier Grand Cru Classé A with unique Cabernet Franc-dominant blend. Known for exotic aromatics and lush texture.
description: Premier Grand Cru Classé A with unique Cabernet Franc-dominant blend. Known for exotic aromatics and lush texture.
tastingNotes: Violets, mulberry, exotic spices, coffee, chocolate, silky tannins, remarkable freshness
history: The 1947 is considered one of the greatest wines ever made. Unique gravel terroir.
servingRecommendation: Decant 2-3 hours. Serve at 16-18°C. More approachable than Left Bank in youth.

name: Château Pétrus
about: The most famous Merlot-based wine. Tiny production from unique blue clay terroir creates extraordinary wines.
description: The most famous Merlot-based wine. Tiny production from unique blue clay terroir creates extraordinary wines.
tastingNotes: Truffle, plum, chocolate, mulberry, iron, exotic spices, velvet texture, incredible concentration
history: Rose to prominence under Jean-Pierre Moueix from 1945. Only 25,000-30,000 bottles annually. No official classification but First Growth prices.
servingRecommendation: Decant 2-4 hours. Serve at 17-18°C. Best after 15-20 years cellaring.

name: Château Ausone
about: Premier Grand Cru Classé A named for Roman poet Ausonius. Dramatic limestone terroir creates ethereal wines.
description: Premier Grand Cru Classé A named for Roman poet Ausonius. Dramatic limestone terroir creates ethereal wines.
tastingNotes: Mineral, violet, dark fruits, spice, ethereal finesse, extraordinary complexity
history: Named for 4th-century poet. Vauthier family ownership. The dramatic cliff-side cellar is UNESCO listed.

name: Château Angélus
about: Premier Grand Cru Classé A known for rich, powerful style. Famous bell-marked label.
description: Premier Grand Cru Classé A known for rich, powerful style. Famous bell-marked label.
tastingNotes: Dark plum, chocolate, mocha, spice, opulent texture, generous fruit
history: Named for chapel bells audible from vineyard. Hubert de Boüard transformed quality from 1980s.

name: Château Pavie
about: Premier Grand Cru Classé A producing powerful, concentrated wines under Gérard Perse.
description: Premier Grand Cru Classé A producing powerful, concentrated wines under Gérard Perse.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, cassis, mocha, minerals, massive concentration, structured tannins
history: Gérard Perse acquired Pavie in 1998 and transformed it with ambitious viticulture and winemaking.

name: Le Pin
about: Tiny 'garage wine' estate challenging Pétrus prices. Seductive, hedonistic style from just 2.7 hectares.
description: Tiny 'garage wine' estate challenging Pétrus prices. Seductive, hedonistic style from just 2.7 hectares.
tastingNotes: Plum, chocolate, exotic spices, mocha, velvet texture, seductive richness
history: Jacques Thienpont created Le Pin in 1979 from small plot with single pine tree. Only 600-700 cases produced.

name: Vieux Château Certan
about: Historic Pomerol estate with higher Cabernet Franc. Elegant alternative to Pétrus power.
description: Historic Pomerol estate with higher Cabernet Franc. Elegant alternative to Pétrus power.
tastingNotes: Violets, plum, truffle, spice, tobacco, refined elegance, Burgundian character
history: Thienpont family ownership since 1924. Higher Cabernet Franc creates more elegant character.

name: Château Lynch-Bages
about: Fifth Growth producing wines of Second Growth quality. The 'poor man's Mouton.'
description: Fifth Growth producing wines of Second Growth quality. The 'poor man's Mouton.'
tastingNotes: Cassis, cedar, graphite, chocolate, tobacco, classic Pauillac character
history: Jean-Michel Cazes transformed Lynch-Bages from the 1970s. Iconic village estate at plateau of Bages.

name: Château Pichon Baron
about: Second Growth producing powerful Pauillac. Impressive château with mirror pool.
description: Second Growth producing powerful Pauillac. Impressive château with mirror pool.
tastingNotes: Cassis, cedar, graphite, chocolate, powerful structure, firm tannins
history: AXA Millésimes ownership since 1987. One of the most improved estates in Bordeaux.

name: Château Pichon Lalande
about: Second Growth known for elegance and higher Merlot content. The most feminine Pauillac.
description: Second Growth known for elegance and higher Merlot content. The most feminine Pauillac.
tastingNotes: Cassis, violets, cedar, graphite, silky elegance, refined structure
history: May-Eliane de Lencquesaing built reputation 1978-2007. Now owned by Champagne Roederer.

name: Château Cos d'Estournel
about: Second Growth with exotic pagoda-style chai. Produces powerful, spicy Saint-Estèphe.
description: Second Growth with exotic pagoda-style chai. Produces powerful, spicy Saint-Estèphe.
tastingNotes: Cassis, spice, cedar, exotic notes, powerful structure, dense concentration
history: Louis Gaspard d'Estournel built exotic chai in 1830s. Now owned by Michel Reybier.

name: Château Ducru-Beaucaillou
about: Second Growth exemplifying Saint-Julien elegance. 'Beautiful pebbles' refers to gravel terroir.
description: Second Growth exemplifying Saint-Julien elegance. 'Beautiful pebbles' refers to gravel terroir.
tastingNotes: Cassis, cedar, graphite, violet, refined elegance, harmonious balance
history: Borie family ownership since 1941. Bruno Borie maintains exceptional standards.

name: Château Léoville-Las Cases
about: Second Growth often performing at First Growth level. Grand Vin from walled vineyard.
description: Second Growth often performing at First Growth level. Grand Vin from walled vineyard.
tastingNotes: Cassis, cedar, graphite, tobacco, powerful structure, intense concentration
history: Jean-Hubert Delon maintains exceptional quality. Walled 'Clos' section produces Grand Vin.

name: Château Palmer
about: Third Growth often rivaling First Growths. Unique high Merlot content creates silky elegance.
description: Third Growth often rivaling First Growths. Unique high Merlot content creates silky elegance.
tastingNotes: Violets, dark berries, exotic spice, cedar, silky texture, Margaux perfume
history: Named for British general Charles Palmer. Biodynamic since 2014.

name: Domaine de la Romanée-Conti (Romanée-Conti)
about: The most prestigious wine in the world. Monopole Grand Cru of just 1.8 hectares producing around 450 cases annually.
description: The most prestigious wine in the world. Monopole Grand Cru of just 1.8 hectares producing around 450 cases annually.
tastingNotes: Rose petals, cherry, exotic spices, forest floor, iron, extraordinary complexity, ethereal texture
history: Monks cultivated vines since 7th century. De Villaine and Leroy families ownership. Benchmark for Pinot Noir worldwide.
servingRecommendation: Decant gently 1-2 hours. Serve at 15-17°C in finest Burgundy glasses.

name: Domaine de la Romanée-Conti La Tâche
about: Monopole Grand Cru considered the most complete of DRC's wines. Larger vineyard than RC allows more production.
description: Monopole Grand Cru considered the most complete of DRC's wines. Larger vineyard than RC allows more production.
tastingNotes: Dark cherry, exotic spices, rose, earth, mineral, extraordinary depth and complexity
history: Acquired by DRC in 1933. At 6 hectares, produces more wine than Romanée-Conti but equal quality.

name: Domaine Leroy Musigny Grand Cru
about: Biodynamic Grand Cru from one of Burgundy's most perfectionist producers. Extraordinary purity.
description: Biodynamic Grand Cru from one of Burgundy's most perfectionist producers. Extraordinary purity.
tastingNotes: Violets, wild strawberry, exotic spices, mineral, forest floor, ethereal elegance
history: Lalou Bize-Leroy purchased domaine in 1988, converting immediately to biodynamics. Extremely low yields.
servingRecommendation: Handle with care; minimal decanting. Serve at 15-16°C in large Burgundy glasses.

name: Domaine Armand Rousseau Chambertin Grand Cru
about: Reference-standard Chambertin from the most respected domaine in the village.
description: Reference-standard Chambertin from the most respected domaine in the village.
tastingNotes: Black cherry, licorice, earth, leather, violets, mineral, firm structure, long finish
history: Founded 1909 by Armand Rousseau. Grandson Eric maintains exceptional quality. Sets standard for Gevrey.
servingRecommendation: Decant 1-2 hours for young wines. Serve at 16-17°C.

name: Domaine Comte Georges de Vogüé Musigny Vieilles Vignes
about: The reference for Musigny Grand Cru. Owns 70% of the vineyard including oldest vines.
description: The reference for Musigny Grand Cru. Owns 70% of the vineyard including oldest vines.
tastingNotes: Violets, red cherry, spice, mineral, silk texture, quintessential elegance
history: De Vogüé family has owned since 1450. François Millet makes wine since 1986.

name: Domaine Georges Roumier Bonnes-Mares Grand Cru
about: Exceptional Grand Cru from one of Burgundy's most consistent producers. Christophe Roumier is a master.
description: Exceptional Grand Cru from one of Burgundy's most consistent producers. Christophe Roumier is a master.
tastingNotes: Dark cherry, earth, spice, mineral, structured elegance
history: Georges Roumier founded domaine in 1924. Grandson Christophe is considered among Burgundy's finest winemakers.

name: Domaine Coche-Dury Meursault Les Perrières
about: The most sought-after white Burgundy producer. Jean-François Coche's wines are legendary.
description: The most sought-after white Burgundy producer. Jean-François Coche's wines are legendary.
tastingNotes: Citrus, mineral, hazelnut, honey, extraordinary depth and precision
history: Jean-François Coche-Dury is considered the greatest white Burgundy winemaker. Wines nearly impossible to obtain.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 12-14°C. Can benefit from brief decanting when young.

name: Domaine Leflaive Bâtard-Montrachet Grand Cru
about: Historic estate pioneering biodynamics in Burgundy. Anne-Claude Leflaive's transformative vision.
description: Historic estate pioneering biodynamics in Burgundy. Anne-Claude Leflaive's transformative vision.
tastingNotes: Citrus, almond, mineral, honey, white flowers, rich yet precise
history: Founded 1717. Anne-Claude converted to biodynamics in 1990s. Nephew Brice de la Morandière continues.

name: Domaine Raveneau Chablis Grand Cru Les Clos
about: The undisputed reference for Chablis. Les Clos is the largest and arguably finest Grand Cru.
description: The undisputed reference for Chablis. Les Clos is the largest and arguably finest Grand Cru.
tastingNotes: Citrus, oyster shell, chalk, mineral, flint, incredible precision and tension
history: Jean-Marie Raveneau's sons Bernard and Didier run domaine. Minimal intervention with old barrels.

name: Château Rayas Châteauneuf-du-Pape
about: Cult producer making 100% Grenache in a blend region. Unique terroir produces ethereal, Burgundian-styled wines.
description: Cult producer making 100% Grenache in a blend region. Unique terroir produces ethereal, Burgundian-styled wines.
tastingNotes: Raspberry, cherry, garrigue herbs, spice, mineral, extraordinary purity and finesse
history: Reynaud family ownership since 1880. Jacques Reynaud developed legendary status before nephew Emmanuel continued.
servingRecommendation: Minimal decanting needed. Serve slightly cool at 15-17°C.

name: E. Guigal Côte-Rôtie La Mouline
about: One of the 'La Las' trilogy representing pinnacle of Northern Rhône Syrah. 11% Viognier for aromatic lift.
description: One of the 'La Las' trilogy representing pinnacle of Northern Rhône Syrah. 11% Viognier for aromatic lift.
tastingNotes: Violets, bacon fat, black olive, apricot, smoke, incredible aromatic complexity
history: Marcel Guigal created single-vineyard 'La La' bottlings starting with La Mouline in 1966. 42 months in new oak.

name: E. Guigal Côte-Rôtie La Landonne
about: 100% Syrah from iron-rich schist soils producing the most powerful of Guigal's single vineyard wines.
description: 100% Syrah from iron-rich schist soils producing the most powerful of Guigal's single vineyard wines.
tastingNotes: Black fruits, tar, iron, leather, black olive, smoke, intense mineral character, massive structure
history: First produced 1978 from vines replanted by Marcel Guigal. Dark, brooding wine requiring significant aging.
servingRecommendation: Decant 4-6 hours minimum. Serve at 17-18°C. Best after 15+ years.

name: E. Guigal Côte-Rôtie La Turque
about: The third 'La La' wine combining power of La Landonne with perfume of La Mouline.
description: The third 'La La' wine combining power of La Landonne with perfume of La Mouline.
tastingNotes: Violets, bacon, dark fruits, spice, smoke, concentrated power with aromatic complexity
history: First produced 1985. Named for the Turque lieu-dit. Combines characteristics of other two 'La Las.'

name: Hermitage La Chapelle (Paul Jaboulet Aîné)
about: Legendary Northern Rhône Syrah. The 1961 is considered one of the greatest wines of 20th century.
description: Legendary Northern Rhône Syrah. The 1961 is considered one of the greatest wines of 20th century.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, leather, tar, smoke, herbs, pepper, profound depth and structure
history: Named for small chapel atop Hermitage hill. Jaboulet family established 1834. Now owned by Frey family.
servingRecommendation: Decant 3-5 hours. Serve at 17-18°C. Best after 15-20 years.

name: Jean-Louis Chave Hermitage
about: The reference-standard Hermitage from family with 500+ years of history on the hill.
description: The reference-standard Hermitage from family with 500+ years of history on the hill.
tastingNotes: Black fruits, smoke, bacon, herbs, mineral, incredible depth with silky texture
history: Chave family has made wine in Hermitage since 1481. Jean-Louis is 16th generation, maintaining traditions.

name: Chapoutier Ermitage Le Pavillon
about: Biodynamic producer's single-vineyard Hermitage. Among the most powerful expressions of the appellation.
description: Biodynamic producer's single-vineyard Hermitage. Among the most powerful expressions of the appellation.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, bacon, smoke, herbs, iron, incredible concentration
history: Michel Chapoutier converted to biodynamics in 1991. Le Pavillon from Les Bessards is top cuvée.

name: Giacomo Conterno Monfortino Barolo Riserva
about: The most sought-after traditional Barolo, made only in exceptional years. Extended aging in large Slavonian oak.
description: The most sought-after traditional Barolo, made only in exceptional years. Extended aging in large Slavonian oak.
tastingNotes: Tar, roses, dried cherry, leather, truffle, tobacco, iron, extraordinary complexity
history: Giovanni Conterno created Monfortino in 1920. Spends 7+ years aging. Roberto Conterno continues tradition.
servingRecommendation: Decant 4-6 hours or more. Serve at 18°C. Best after 20+ years additional cellaring.

name: Bruno Giacosa Barolo Falletto Vigna Le Rocche Riserva
about: Legendary producer's top Barolo. Red label Riservas represent pinnacle of traditional winemaking.
description: Legendary producer's top Barolo. Red label Riservas represent pinnacle of traditional winemaking.
tastingNotes: Rose, tar, cherry, licorice, truffle, mint, incredible purity and precision
pairings: Tajarin pasta with butter and truffle
history: Bruno Giacosa was 'master of Barolo.' Red-label Riservas, produced only in exceptional years, are Italy's most collectible.

name: Gaja Barbaresco
about: Revolutionary producer who modernized Piedmont while maintaining tradition. Flagship showcasing elegance and power.
description: Revolutionary producer who modernized Piedmont while maintaining tradition. Flagship showcasing elegance and power.
tastingNotes: Rose petals, red cherry, licorice, tar, spice, chocolate, polished tannins
history: Angelo Gaja transformed family estate from 1960s, introducing French techniques. Elevated Barbaresco's reputation.

name: Bartolo Mascarello Barolo
about: Iconic traditional producer making single Barolo from blended vineyards. Famous hand-drawn labels.
description: Iconic traditional producer making single Barolo from blended vineyards. Famous hand-drawn labels.
tastingNotes: Rose, tar, cherry, earth, tobacco, classic traditional character
history: Bartolo Mascarello (1927-2005) was legend and traditionalist. Daughter Maria Teresa continues vision.

name: Giuseppe Mascarello Barolo Monprivato
about: Traditional Barolo from monopole vineyard. Among the most elegant expressions of Nebbiolo.
description: Traditional Barolo from monopole vineyard. Among the most elegant expressions of Nebbiolo.
tastingNotes: Rose, cherry, tar, licorice, tobacco, extraordinary elegance
history: Mascarello family has owned Monprivato since 1904. Mauro Mascarello continues traditional methods.

name: Aldo Conterno Barolo Granbussia
about: Legendary producer's top wine from multiple vineyard sources. Only made in exceptional years.
description: Legendary producer's top wine from multiple vineyard sources. Only made in exceptional years.
tastingNotes: Rose, tar, licorice, truffle, earth, massive structure
history: Aldo Conterno (brother of Giovanni) founded estate in 1969. Granbussia is reserve selection.

name: Vietti Barolo Ravera
about: Historic Barolo producer with exceptional single-vineyard bottlings. Ravera is among top sites.
description: Historic Barolo producer with exceptional single-vineyard bottlings. Ravera is among top sites.
tastingNotes: Rose, tar, cherry, licorice, mineral, elegant structure
history: Vietti family has made wine since 1900s. Luca Currado now leads.

name: Sandrone Barolo Le Vigne
about: Luciano Sandrone's multi-vineyard blend showing accessible yet age-worthy modern style.
description: Luciano Sandrone's multi-vineyard blend showing accessible yet age-worthy modern style.
tastingNotes: Cherry, rose, spice, chocolate, refined tannins
history: Luciano Sandrone started with 1 hectare in 1978. Now among Barolo's most respected.

name: Produttori del Barbaresco Barbaresco Riserva
about: Cooperative producing outstanding single-vineyard Barbaresco Riservas at remarkable value.
description: Cooperative producing outstanding single-vineyard Barbaresco Riservas at remarkable value.
tastingNotes: Cherry, rose, tar, leather, mineral, elegant power
history: Founded 1958 by local priest. Nine cru bottlings from member vineyards. Exceptional quality-to-price.

name: Biondi-Santi Brunello di Montalcino Riserva
about: The original creator of Brunello di Montalcino. Traditional producer making age-worthy wines since 1888.
description: The original creator of Brunello di Montalcino. Traditional producer making age-worthy wines since 1888.
tastingNotes: Cherry, leather, tobacco, dried herbs, earth, tea, elegant structure
history: Ferruccio Biondi-Santi created Brunello in 1880s by isolating Sangiovese Grosso. Riserva only in exceptional years.
servingRecommendation: Decant 3-4 hours. Serve at 17-18°C. Benefits from 15+ years aging.

name: Soldera Case Basse Brunello di Montalcino
about: Uncompromising perfectionist creating Brunello of extraordinary purity. Biodynamic pioneer.
description: Uncompromising perfectionist creating Brunello of extraordinary purity. Biodynamic pioneer.
tastingNotes: Wild cherry, rose, violet, minerals, herbs, incredible purity and finesse
history: Gianfranco Soldera created estate from scratch in 1972. Cult status. Vandals destroyed six vintages in 2012.

name: Sassicaia
about: The original 'Super Tuscan' that sparked Italian wine revolution. Cabernet Sauvignon dominant.
description: The original 'Super Tuscan' that sparked Italian wine revolution. Cabernet Sauvignon dominant.
tastingNotes: Blackcurrant, cedar, graphite, Mediterranean herbs, tobacco, mint, structured elegance
history: Mario Incisa della Rocchetta planted Cabernet in 1944, inspired by Bordeaux. Released commercially 1968.

name: Tignanello
about: Antinori's groundbreaking Super Tuscan. First Sangiovese in barriques, first Chianti without white grapes.
description: Antinori's groundbreaking Super Tuscan. First Sangiovese in barriques, first Chianti without white grapes.
tastingNotes: Cherry, blackberry, vanilla, spice, tobacco, elegant tannins
history: Created by Piero Antinori with Giacomo Tachis in 1971. Revolutionized Italian winemaking.

name: Ornellaia
about: Super Tuscan estate producing polished, powerful Bordeaux-style wines.
description: Super Tuscan estate producing polished, powerful Bordeaux-style wines.
tastingNotes: Blackcurrant, dark chocolate, coffee, cedar, Mediterranean herbs, plush texture
history: Founded 1981 by Lodovico Antinori, first vintage 1985. Now owned by Frescobaldi.

name: Masseto
about: Italy's most expensive wine. 100% Merlot from blue clay soils rivaling Pétrus.
description: Italy's most expensive wine. 100% Merlot from blue clay soils rivaling Pétrus.
tastingNotes: Plum, chocolate, espresso, violets, truffle, velvet texture, incredible richness
history: Originally part of Ornellaia, became separate wine 1986. Unique clay soils ideal for Merlot. Only ~2,500 cases.

name: Giuseppe Quintarelli Amarone della Valpolicella
about: The legendary 'maestro' of Amarone. Traditional production with extended aging creates profound complexity.
description: The legendary 'maestro' of Amarone. Traditional production with extended aging creates profound complexity.
tastingNotes: Dried cherry, fig, chocolate, tar, herbs, smoke, incredible concentration and sweetness
history: Giuseppe Quintarelli (1927-2012) considered greatest Amarone producer. Extended drying (4 months) and aging.

name: Dal Forno Romano Amarone della Valpolicella
about: Modern, powerful Amarone using extreme concentration methods. Among most intense wines anywhere.
description: Modern, powerful Amarone using extreme concentration methods. Among most intense wines anywhere.
tastingNotes: Black cherry, dark chocolate, coffee, tar, dried fruits, massive concentration
history: Romano Dal Forno creates intensely concentrated wines through extended drying and new French oak aging.

name: Vega Sicilia Único
about: Spain's most legendary wine estate, founded 1864. Único spends 10+ years aging before release.
description: Spain's most legendary wine estate, founded 1864. Único spends 10+ years aging before release.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, leather, cedar, tobacco, spice, tar, polished tannins, incredible length
history: Founded by Eloy Lecanda who planted Bordeaux varieties. Historic vintages command extraordinary prices.

name: Vega Sicilia Valbuena
about: Vega Sicilia's 'second' wine spending 5 years aging. More accessible but exceptional quality.
description: Vega Sicilia's 'second' wine spending 5 years aging. More accessible but exceptional quality.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, cherry, leather, tobacco, spice, refined elegance
history: Originally created as earlier-drinking option to Único. Valbuena 5° indicates 5 years aging.

name: Pingus
about: Cult wine by Danish winemaker Peter Sisseck. Tiny production from old vine Tempranillo.
description: Cult wine by Danish winemaker Peter Sisseck. Tiny production from old vine Tempranillo.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, licorice, espresso, smoke, dark chocolate, spice, incredible intensity
history: First vintage 1995. Immediately acclaimed as Spain's first 'garage wine.' Only ~500 cases annually.

name: R. López de Heredia Viña Tondonia Gran Reserva
about: Traditional Rioja unchanged since founding in 1877. Extended American oak aging creates ethereal wines.
description: Traditional Rioja unchanged since founding in 1877. Extended American oak aging creates ethereal wines.
tastingNotes: Dried cherry, leather, tobacco, dried flowers, oxidative notes, earth, extraordinary finesse
history: López de Heredia family maintains 19th-century traditions. Wines age 10+ years before release.
servingRecommendation: Decant briefly or serve directly. Serve at 16-17°C.

name: Clos Mogador
about: Pioneer of modern Priorat. René Barbier's estate produces powerful yet elegant wines from ancient slate.
description: Pioneer of modern Priorat. René Barbier's estate produces powerful yet elegant wines from ancient slate.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, mineral, slate, herbs, licorice, black pepper, incredible mineral intensity
history: René Barbier and four friends 'discovered' Priorat in 1980s, reviving abandoned vineyards. First vintage 1989.

name: L'Ermita (Alvaro Palacios)
about: Single vineyard wine from extremely old Garnacha on steep slate. Among Spain's most expensive wines.
description: Single vineyard wine from extremely old Garnacha on steep slate. Among Spain's most expensive wines.
tastingNotes: Raspberry, mineral, herbs, slate, smoke, extraordinary purity and depth
history: Alvaro Palacios discovered abandoned vineyard with 100+ year old vines. First vintage 1993. Only 200-300 cases.

name: Viña Tondonia Gran Reserva Blanco
about: Spain's most legendary white wine. Extended oxidative aging creates hauntingly beautiful wines.
description: Spain's most legendary white wine. Extended oxidative aging creates hauntingly beautiful wines.
tastingNotes: Almond, dried flowers, honey, oxidative complexity, extraordinary freshness
history: Ages 10+ years in barrel and bottle before release. Among oldest drinkable whites in world.

name: Barca Velha
about: Portugal's most legendary dry red. The country's equivalent to Vega Sicilia Único.
description: Portugal's most legendary dry red. The country's equivalent to Vega Sicilia Único.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, dried herbs, cedar, leather, mineral, extraordinary complexity
history: Created 1952 by Fernando Nicolau de Almeida at Ferreira. Only 18 vintages released between 1952-2008.

name: Screaming Eagle Cabernet Sauvignon
about: America's most famous cult Cabernet. Tiny production and perfect scores create extraordinary demand.
description: America's most famous cult Cabernet. Tiny production and perfect scores create extraordinary demand.
tastingNotes: Blackcurrant, cassis, graphite, cedar, violets, chocolate, plush silky tannins
history: Founded by Jean Phillips 1986, first vintage 1992. Winemaker Heidi Barrett. Sold to Stan Kroenke for $30+ million.

name: Harlan Estate
about: Bill Harlan's vision of a Napa 'First Growth.' Impeccably crafted Bordeaux-style blend.
description: Bill Harlan's vision of a Napa 'First Growth.' Impeccably crafted Bordeaux-style blend.
tastingNotes: Black fruits, espresso, chocolate, cedar, graphite, tobacco, impeccable balance
history: Bill Harlan planted hillside vineyard 1984, first release 1990. Designed for generations of quality.

name: Opus One
about: Historic joint venture between Robert Mondavi and Baron Philippe de Rothschild.
description: Historic joint venture between Robert Mondavi and Baron Philippe de Rothschild.
tastingNotes: Cassis, violet, cedar, dark chocolate, spice, refined tannins
history: Announced 1979, first vintage 1979. Iconic landmark designed by Scott Johnson. ~25,000 cases annually.

name: Ridge Monte Bello
about: California's greatest age-worthy Cabernet from limestone at 2,600 feet. Paul Draper's masterwork.
description: California's greatest age-worthy Cabernet from limestone at 2,600 feet. Paul Draper's masterwork.
tastingNotes: Cassis, mineral, cedar, herbs, graphite, tobacco, incredible structure and freshness
history: Vineyard planted 1886. Ridge since 1962. The 1971 placed fifth in 1976 Judgment of Paris, first in 2006 re-tasting.

name: Sine Qua Non
about: Manfred Krankl's cult winery with uniquely named wines in tiny quantities. Each vintage different.
description: Manfred Krankl's cult winery with uniquely named wines in tiny quantities. Each vintage different.
tastingNotes: Dark fruits, spice, exotic aromatics, chocolate, garrigue - varies by vintage
pairings: aged cheeses - matches the specific wine
history: Founded 1994 by Austrian-born Krankl. Every wine unique name and label. Never same wine twice.

name: Dominus
about: Christian Moueix's (Pétrus) California estate. Elegant, European-styled Napa blend.
description: Christian Moueix's (Pétrus) California estate. Elegant, European-styled Napa blend.
tastingNotes: Cassis, herbs, graphite, tobacco, earth, restrained power
history: Founded 1982 by Christian Moueix. First vintage 1983. Iconic winery by Herzog & de Meuron.

name: Caymus Special Selection Cabernet Sauvignon
about: Chuck Wagner's rich, opulent style. First American wine to win Wine Spectator Wine of Year twice.
description: Chuck Wagner's rich, opulent style. First American wine to win Wine Spectator Wine of Year twice.
tastingNotes: Cassis, dark cherry, chocolate, vanilla, sweet oak, plush texture
history: Founded 1972. Special Selection first 1975. Known for ripe, extracted style defining Napa for many consumers.

name: Heitz Martha's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon
about: Historic single-vineyard Cabernet famous for eucalyptus/mint character. One of Napa's first vineyard-designated.
description: Historic single-vineyard Cabernet famous for eucalyptus/mint character. One of Napa's first vineyard-designated.
tastingNotes: Eucalyptus, mint, cassis, cedar, chocolate, distinctive herbal signature
history: First produced 1966 from Tom and Martha May's vineyard. Distinctive eucalyptus from nearby trees.

name: Marcassin Pinot Noir Marcassin Vineyard
about: Helen Turley's perfectionist estate producing California's most Burgundian Pinot Noir.
description: Helen Turley's perfectionist estate producing California's most Burgundian Pinot Noir.
tastingNotes: Red cherry, rose, earth, spice, mineral, Burgundian elegance
history: Founded 1990 by Helen Turley. Named for French word for wild boar. Only ~1,000 cases total.

name: Williams Selyem Pinot Noir Rochioli Riverblock
about: Iconic single-vineyard Pinot from producer that put Russian River on the map.
description: Iconic single-vineyard Pinot from producer that put Russian River on the map.
tastingNotes: Cherry, cola, earth, spice, silky texture
history: Founded 1981 by Burt Williams and Ed Selyem. Legendary mailing list. Sold to John Dyson 1998.

name: Penfolds Grange
about: Australia's most iconic wine, created by Max Schubert in 1951. Powerful Shiraz aged in American oak.
description: Australia's most iconic wine, created by Max Schubert in 1951. Powerful Shiraz aged in American oak.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, chocolate, mocha, licorice, tar, earth, incredible concentration
history: Max Schubert created Grange 1951 after visiting Bordeaux. Initially rejected, eventually recognized as Australia's greatest.

name: Henschke Hill of Grace
about: Single-vineyard Shiraz from vines planted in 1860s. Australia's most age-worthy wine alongside Grange.
description: Single-vineyard Shiraz from vines planted in 1860s. Australia's most age-worthy wine alongside Grange.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, pepper, licorice, sage, mineral, incredible elegance and complexity
history: Named for Gnadenberg Lutheran church overlooking vineyard. Henschke family since 1860s.

name: Torbreck RunRig
about: Dave Powell's tribute to Northern Rhône Syrah. Old vine Shiraz co-fermented with Viognier.
description: Dave Powell's tribute to Northern Rhône Syrah. Old vine Shiraz co-fermented with Viognier.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, violet, apricot, chocolate, licorice, spice, opulent texture
history: Named for ancient Scottish plow. Dave Powell founded 1994, sourcing from Barossa's oldest vines.

name: Rockford Basket Press Shiraz
about: Traditional Barossa using historic basket press. Robert O'Callaghan's tribute to old-fashioned winemaking.
description: Traditional Barossa using historic basket press. Robert O'Callaghan's tribute to old-fashioned winemaking.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, spice, earth, chocolate, savory herbs
history: Robert O'Callaghan founded Rockford 1984, using traditional equipment including restored 1918 basket press.

name: Penfolds Bin 707 Cabernet Sauvignon
about: Penfolds' answer to Grange with Cabernet. Powerful, concentrated Australian Cabernet.
description: Penfolds' answer to Grange with Cabernet. Powerful, concentrated Australian Cabernet.
tastingNotes: Cassis, chocolate, mint, cedar, eucalyptus, concentrated power
history: First made 1964. Named for bin where barrels stored. Not made every year.

name: Cullen Diana Madeline
about: Biodynamic estate producing Australia's finest Bordeaux blend. Named for founder Diana Cullen.
description: Biodynamic estate producing Australia's finest Bordeaux blend. Named for founder Diana Cullen.
tastingNotes: Cassis, herbs, graphite, violet, refined structure
history: Vanya Cullen converted to biodynamics 2003. Diana Madeline honors her mother.

name: Moss Wood Cabernet Sauvignon
about: Historic Margaret River producer making elegant, age-worthy Cabernet since 1969.
description: Historic Margaret River producer making elegant, age-worthy Cabernet since 1969.
tastingNotes: Cassis, cedar, herbs, chocolate, refined elegance
history: Founded 1969 by Bill and Sandra Pannell, one of Margaret River's pioneers.

name: Leeuwin Estate Art Series Chardonnay
about: Australia's most prestigious Chardonnay. Consistent benchmark for the variety in the New World.
description: Australia's most prestigious Chardonnay. Consistent benchmark for the variety in the New World.
tastingNotes: Citrus, stone fruit, mineral, cashew, elegant oak, remarkable complexity
history: Robert Mondavi advised on first plantings 1974. Art Series label features commissioned Australian art.

name: Kanonkop Paul Sauer
about: South Africa's benchmark Bordeaux blend from historic estate. Named for founder Paul Sauer.
description: South Africa's benchmark Bordeaux blend from historic estate. Named for founder Paul Sauer.
tastingNotes: Cassis, cedar, tobacco, earth, chocolate, classic structure
history: Founded 1910. Named for cannon fired to announce ships. Paul Sauer first 1981. Abrie Beeslaar winemaker since 1999.

name: Meerlust Rubicon
about: Pioneer South African Bordeaux blend from historic estate dating to 1693.
description: Pioneer South African Bordeaux blend from historic estate dating to 1693.
tastingNotes: Cassis, cedar, herbs, tobacco, chocolate, elegant structure
history: First Rubicon vintage 1980. Created by Nico Myburgh. Estate in Myburgh family since 1756.

name: Catena Zapata Adrianna Vineyard Malbec
about: Argentina's most acclaimed Malbec from high-altitude vineyard at 4,757 feet.
description: Argentina's most acclaimed Malbec from high-altitude vineyard at 4,757 feet.
tastingNotes: Violet, blackberry, mineral, spice, graphite, elegant structure
history: Adrianna Vineyard planted 1992 at extreme altitude. Named for Nicolas Catena's daughter. Multiple 100-point scores.

name: Clos de los Siete
about: Michel Rolland's ambitious project uniting seven estates. Accessible, high-quality Malbec blend.
description: Michel Rolland's ambitious project uniting seven estates. Accessible, high-quality Malbec blend.
tastingNotes: Plum, blackberry, chocolate, vanilla, spice, plush texture
history: Michel Rolland united seven investors in 1998. Each estate contributes to the blend.

name: Almaviva
about: Joint venture between Concha y Toro and Baron Philippe de Rothschild. Chile's First Growth.
description: Joint venture between Concha y Toro and Baron Philippe de Rothschild. Chile's First Growth.
tastingNotes: Cassis, dark chocolate, tobacco, cedar, herbs, refined structure
history: Founded 1997. Named after Beaumarchais character in Mozart's opera. First vintage 1996.

name: Seña
about: Eduardo Chadwick and Robert Mondavi's vision of Chilean icon. Biodynamically farmed.
description: Eduardo Chadwick and Robert Mondavi's vision of Chilean icon. Biodynamically farmed.
tastingNotes: Cassis, herbs, mineral, tobacco, elegant structure
history: First vintage 1995. Won famous Berlin Tasting of 2004, beating top Bordeaux and Italian wines.

name: Château Musar
about: Legendary Lebanese producer making wine through civil war. Unique blend of Cinsault, Carignan, Cabernet.
description: Legendary Lebanese producer making wine through civil war. Unique blend of Cinsault, Carignan, Cabernet.
tastingNotes: Cherry, spice, leather, earth, cedar, wild herbs, unique exotic character
history: Serge Hochar made wine throughout Lebanese civil war. Family founded estate 1930. Releases with significant bottle age.

name: Domaine de la Romanée-Conti Montrachet Grand Cru
about: The world's most expensive white wine from greatest white Burgundy vineyard. DRC owns just 0.67 hectares.
description: The world's most expensive white wine from greatest white Burgundy vineyard. DRC owns just 0.67 hectares.
tastingNotes: Citrus, white flowers, almond, mineral, hazelnut, extraordinary complexity and length
history: DRC acquired Montrachet parcel 1963. Only 250-300 cases annually. Among rarest wines in world.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 12-14°C in large Burgundy glasses. No decanting necessary.

name: Coche-Dury Corton-Charlemagne Grand Cru
about: Most sought-after white Burgundy producer. Legendary concentration and longevity.
description: Most sought-after white Burgundy producer. Legendary concentration and longevity.
tastingNotes: Citrus, mineral, hazelnut, honey, extraordinary depth and precision
history: Jean-François Coche-Dury considered greatest white Burgundy winemaker. Wines nearly impossible to obtain.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 12-14°C. Can benefit from brief decanting when young.

name: Louis Roederer Cristal
about: Created 1876 for Tsar Alexander II. Prestige cuvée in distinctive clear bottle.
description: Created 1876 for Tsar Alexander II. Prestige cuvée in distinctive clear bottle.
tastingNotes: Brioche, citrus, white peach, mineral, chalk, fine persistent bubbles
history: Tsar Alexander demanded clear bottle to prevent assassination. 60% Pinot Noir, 40% Chardonnay, aged 6+ years.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 8-10°C. No decanting; use proper flutes or white wine glasses.

name: Dom Pérignon
about: Moët & Chandon's prestige cuvée named for legendary monk. Only produced in exceptional years.
description: Moët & Chandon's prestige cuvée named for legendary monk. Only produced in exceptional years.
tastingNotes: Brioche, citrus, almond, mineral, smoke with age, remarkable elegance
history: Named for Benedictine monk who made major contributions to Champagne in 17th century. First vintage 1921.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 8-10°C. Aged vintages can be decanted briefly.

name: Krug Grande Cuvée
about: Multi-vintage Champagne from most prestigious House. Blend of 120+ wines from 10+ years.
description: Multi-vintage Champagne from most prestigious House. Blend of 120+ wines from 10+ years.
tastingNotes: Brioche, hazelnut, citrus, honey, spice, toasted bread, extraordinary depth
history: Founded 1843 by Joseph Krug. Each bottle labeled with edition number.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 10-12°C, slightly warmer than most Champagnes.

name: Krug Clos du Mesnil
about: Single-vineyard Blanc de Blancs from 1.84-hectare walled vineyard. Perhaps greatest single-vineyard Champagne.
description: Single-vineyard Blanc de Blancs from 1.84-hectare walled vineyard. Perhaps greatest single-vineyard Champagne.
tastingNotes: Citrus, chalk, mineral, brioche, extraordinary precision and finesse
history: First vintage 1979. Walled vineyard one of coldest in Champagne. Only produced in exceptional years.

name: Salon Blanc de Blancs
about: Single-vineyard, single-vintage Blanc de Blancs made only in exceptional years. Champagne's most exclusive.
description: Single-vineyard, single-vintage Blanc de Blancs made only in exceptional years. Champagne's most exclusive.
tastingNotes: Citrus, chalk, mineral, brioche, toast, incredible aging potential
history: Eugène-Aimé Salon founded 1911, making only Blanc de Blancs from Le Mesnil. Only 37 vintages released in 100+ years.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 10-12°C. Can decant aged vintages.

name: Pol Roger Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill
about: Prestige cuvée honoring Winston Churchill. Powerful, structured Champagne.
description: Prestige cuvée honoring Winston Churchill. Powerful, structured Champagne.
tastingNotes: Brioche, citrus, toast, almond, white fruits, powerful structure
history: Created 1984, first released 1975 vintage. Blend kept secret but believed Pinot Noir dominant. Churchill drank Pol Roger daily.

name: Taittinger Comtes de Champagne Blanc de Blancs
about: Prestige Blanc de Blancs from 100% Grand Cru Côte des Blancs. Elegant, refined style.
description: Prestige Blanc de Blancs from 100% Grand Cru Côte des Blancs. Elegant, refined style.
tastingNotes: Citrus, white flowers, brioche, mineral, chalk, elegant finesse
history: First vintage 1952. Named for Counts of Champagne who ruled region in medieval times.

name: Billecart-Salmon Cuvée Nicolas François
about: Prestige cuvée from family-owned house known for elegant, precise Champagnes.
description: Prestige cuvée from family-owned house known for elegant, precise Champagnes.
tastingNotes: Brioche, citrus, almond, honey, mineral, refined complexity
history: Founded 1818. Named for Nicolas François Billecart and Elisabeth Salmon. One of last family-owned grande marques.

name: Bollinger La Grande Année
about: James Bond's champagne. Vintage prestige cuvée from traditional, Pinot-dominant house.
description: James Bond's champagne. Vintage prestige cuvée from traditional, Pinot-dominant house.
tastingNotes: Brioche, apple, spice, almond, rich and structured
history: Bollinger featured in James Bond films since 1973. Family-owned. 60% Pinot Noir, 30% Chardonnay.

name: Ruinart Dom Ruinart Blanc de Blancs
about: Prestige cuvée from oldest Champagne house (1729). Pure, elegant Blanc de Blancs.
description: Prestige cuvée from oldest Champagne house (1729). Pure, elegant Blanc de Blancs.
tastingNotes: Citrus, white flowers, brioche, chalk, mineral elegance
history: Ruinart founded 1729 by Nicolas Ruinart. Dom Ruinart honors his uncle, Dom Thierry Ruinart.

name: Trimbach Clos Ste Hune Riesling
about: Alsace's most prestigious Riesling from monopole vineyard within Grand Cru Rosacker. Legendary aging.
description: Alsace's most prestigious Riesling from monopole vineyard within Grand Cru Rosacker. Legendary aging.
tastingNotes: Citrus, mineral, honey, petrol with age, extraordinary complexity
history: Trimbach family has owned 1.67-hectare vineyard since 1626. Never labeled Grand Cru due to family philosophy.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 10-12°C. Can benefit from years of aging.

name: Zind-Humbrecht Rangen de Thann Grand Cru Pinot Gris
about: Biodynamic producer's wine from steep, volcanic Rangen. Alsace's most powerful Pinot Gris.
description: Biodynamic producer's wine from steep, volcanic Rangen. Alsace's most powerful Pinot Gris.
tastingNotes: Smoke, minerals, tropical fruit, honey, incredible power and depth
history: Olivier Humbrecht MW converted to biodynamics. Rangen is Alsace's steepest and southernmost Grand Cru.

name: Egon Müller Scharzhofberger Riesling Trockenbeerenauslese
about: The world's most expensive Riesling. Produced only in exceptional years from botrytized grapes.
description: The world's most expensive Riesling. Produced only in exceptional years from botrytized grapes.
tastingNotes: Apricot, honey, exotic fruits, slate, mineral, electric acidity, incredible concentration
history: Egon Müller IV continues family tradition since 1797. Scharzhofberger considered among world's greatest vineyards.

name: Joh. Jos. Prüm Wehlener Sonnenuhr Riesling Auslese
about: Reference-standard Mosel Riesling from famous sundial vineyard. Impeccable balance.
description: Reference-standard Mosel Riesling from famous sundial vineyard. Impeccable balance.
tastingNotes: Peach, apricot, slate, mineral, honey, extraordinary precision
history: Prüm family has made wine in Wehlen since 1911. 'Sonnenuhr' (sundial) on steep slope helps ripen grapes.

name: Dönnhoff Niederhäuser Hermannshöhle Riesling Grosses Gewächs
about: Helmut Dönnhoff's legendary dry Riesling from greatest Nahe vineyard. Mineral intensity and precision.
description: Helmut Dönnhoff's legendary dry Riesling from greatest Nahe vineyard. Mineral intensity and precision.
tastingNotes: Citrus, peach, slate, mineral, smoke, incredible precision and depth
history: Hermannshöhle has volcanic and slate soils creating unique mineral character. Dönnhoff considered Nahe's greatest.

name: Klaus Peter Keller G-Max Riesling
about: Cult German Riesling from mystery vineyard. Klaus Peter Keller's most sought-after wine.
description: Cult German Riesling from mystery vineyard. Klaus Peter Keller's most sought-after wine.
tastingNotes: Citrus, mineral, smoke, herbs, extraordinary complexity
history: First produced 2003. Vineyard location kept secret. Tiny production makes it nearly impossible to obtain.

name: F.X. Pichler Kellerberg Riesling Smaragd
about: Austria's most prestigious dry Riesling producer. Powerful, concentrated wines from steep terraces.
description: Austria's most prestigious dry Riesling producer. Powerful, concentrated wines from steep terraces.
tastingNotes: Peach, apricot, mineral, spice, citrus, impressive power and finesse
history: Franz Xaver Pichler created Smaragd classification for Wachau's ripest wines. Son Lucas continues tradition.

name: Nikolaihof Vinothek Riesling
about: Biodynamic pioneer producing Austria's most age-worthy Rieslings. Aged in barrel years before release.
description: Biodynamic pioneer producing Austria's most age-worthy Rieslings. Aged in barrel years before release.
tastingNotes: Dried apricot, honey, mineral, oxidative complexity, extraordinary depth
history: Oldest winery in Austria (since 985 AD). Vinothek releases aged 5-15 years before sale.

name: Kongsgaard Chardonnay
about: John Kongsgaard's cult Chardonnay with intense, powerful style. Among California's most sought-after whites.
description: John Kongsgaard's cult Chardonnay with intense, powerful style. Among California's most sought-after whites.
tastingNotes: Tropical fruit, citrus, butter, mineral, spice, incredible richness
history: John Kongsgaard was winemaker at Newton before starting own label 1996. Known for indigenous yeast.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 12-14°C. Can benefit from decanting.

name: Kistler Vineyard Chardonnay
about: Steve Kistler's Burgundy-inspired Chardonnay from estate vineyard. California's benchmark for elegance.
description: Steve Kistler's Burgundy-inspired Chardonnay from estate vineyard. California's benchmark for elegance.
tastingNotes: Citrus, stone fruit, mineral, butter, elegant oak integration
history: Steve Kistler founded winery 1978. Multiple single-vineyard bottlings but Kistler Vineyard is estate benchmark.

name: Peter Michael Ma Belle-Fille Chardonnay
about: Sir Peter Michael's Burgundy-inspired estate producing refined, complex Chardonnay.
description: Sir Peter Michael's Burgundy-inspired estate producing refined, complex Chardonnay.
tastingNotes: Citrus, mineral, hazelnut, butter, elegant structure
history: Sir Peter Michael, British entrepreneur, founded estate 1982. Name means 'my beautiful daughter-in-law.'

name: Château d'Yquem
about: The world's most prestigious sweet wine. Premier Cru Supérieur classification unique in Bordeaux.
description: The world's most prestigious sweet wine. Premier Cru Supérieur classification unique in Bordeaux.
tastingNotes: Apricot, honey, vanilla, saffron, orange peel, caramel, extraordinary concentration and freshness
history: Classified alone as Premier Cru Supérieur 1855. Lur Saluces family 400 years before LVMH acquisition.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 10-12°C. Can be enjoyed young or aged decades.

name: Château Haut-Brion Blanc
about: Rare dry white from First Growth. One of the world's greatest white wines.
description: Rare dry white from First Growth. One of the world's greatest white wines.
tastingNotes: Citrus, white flowers, mineral, honey, waxy, incredible complexity
history: Only ~7,000 bottles produced annually. Among Bordeaux's rarest wines.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 12-14°C. Can benefit from decanting.

name: Château Climens
about: Premier Cru Barsac producing elegant, precise sweet wines. Often rivals d'Yquem.
description: Premier Cru Barsac producing elegant, precise sweet wines. Often rivals d'Yquem.
tastingNotes: Apricot, citrus, honey, floral, mineral, remarkable elegance and freshness
history: Classified Premier Cru 1855. Organic since 2010, biodynamic since 2014 under Bérénice Lurton.

name: Château Suduiraut
about: Premier Cru estate neighboring d'Yquem. Rich, opulent style of Sauternes.
description: Premier Cru estate neighboring d'Yquem. Rich, opulent style of Sauternes.
tastingNotes: Apricot, mango, honey, vanilla, caramel, lush richness
history: Park designed by Le Nôtre (Versailles). Owned by AXA Millésimes since 1992.

name: Domaines Ott Château de Selle Rosé
about: The benchmark for Provence rosé. Distinctive bottle shape, impeccable quality.
description: The benchmark for Provence rosé. Distinctive bottle shape, impeccable quality.
tastingNotes: Peach, white flowers, citrus, herbs, mineral, refined elegance
history: Founded 1896 by Marcel Ott. Three estates produce distinctive rosés. Amphora bottle instantly recognizable.

name: Château d'Esclans Garrus
about: Luxury Provence rosé created by Sacha Lichine. Oak-aged for complexity and aging potential.
description: Luxury Provence rosé created by Sacha Lichine. Oak-aged for complexity and aging potential.
tastingNotes: Stone fruit, spice, citrus, mineral, creamy texture
history: Sacha Lichine (son of Alexis) created luxury rosé category in 2006.

name: Taylor's Vintage Port
about: The benchmark for Vintage Port. Classic British shipper style with remarkable aging potential.
description: The benchmark for Vintage Port. Classic British shipper style with remarkable aging potential.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, plum, chocolate, spice, violets, incredible concentration
history: Taylor's benchmark since 1692. Declares vintage in exceptional years only. Aged in bottle.
servingRecommendation: Decant 4-6 hours or more. Serve at 16-18°C.

name: Fonseca Vintage Port
about: Opulent, rich style of Vintage Port. Owned by Taylor's but maintains distinct character.
description: Opulent, rich style of Vintage Port. Owned by Taylor's but maintains distinct character.
tastingNotes: Plum, fig, chocolate, exotic spices, rich and luscious
history: Founded 1822. More opulent, hedonistic style than Taylor's.

name: Graham's Vintage Port
about: Sweet, rich style of Vintage Port from Symington family portfolio.
description: Sweet, rich style of Vintage Port from Symington family portfolio.
tastingNotes: Plum, blackberry, chocolate, mint, rich sweetness
history: Founded 1820 by William and John Graham. Known for sweeter, approachable style.

name: Quinta do Noval Nacional
about: Legendary Port from ungrafted vines. Among the rarest and most expensive Ports.
description: Legendary Port from ungrafted vines. Among the rarest and most expensive Ports.
tastingNotes: Intense dark fruits, violets, minerals, spice, extraordinary concentration
history: Nacional from 2.5 hectares of ungrafted vines surviving phylloxera. 1931 perhaps greatest Port ever.

name: Dow's Vintage Port
about: Driest style of major Vintage Port shippers. Firm and structured with great longevity.
description: Driest style of major Vintage Port shippers. Firm and structured with great longevity.
tastingNotes: Blackberry, violet, dark chocolate, firm structure, less sweet than others
history: Founded 1798. Symington family ownership. Known for drier, more austere style.

name: Tio Pepe Fino Sherry
about: The world's best-selling Fino Sherry. Benchmark for this light, dry style.
description: The world's best-selling Fino Sherry. Benchmark for this light, dry style.
tastingNotes: Almond, yeast, saline, citrus, incredibly fresh and dry
history: González Byass founded 1835. Tio Pepe ('Uncle Joe') was founder's uncle. Ages under flor in solera.
servingRecommendation: Serve very cold at 6-8°C. Consume shortly after opening.

name: Lustau Almacenista Oloroso Sherry
about: Rare Sherry from individual almacenistas. Oxidatively aged for rich, complex character.
description: Rare Sherry from individual almacenistas. Oxidatively aged for rich, complex character.
tastingNotes: Walnut, caramel, dried fruit, leather, tobacco, incredibly complex
history: Lustau pioneered Almacenista bottlings, showcasing small private stockholders' wines.

name: El Maestro Sierra Amontillado
about: Traditional bodega producing exceptional aged Sherries. Amontillado combines Fino and Oloroso qualities.
description: Traditional bodega producing exceptional aged Sherries. Amontillado combines Fino and Oloroso qualities.
tastingNotes: Hazelnut, caramel, dried fruit, saline, amber complexity
history: Founded 1830. Pilar Plá continues traditional methods. Sherries aged for decades in cathedral-like bodega.

name: Barbeito Single Cask Madeira
about: Premium Madeira specializing in single-cask, single-vintage bottlings. Extraordinary longevity.
description: Premium Madeira specializing in single-cask, single-vintage bottlings. Extraordinary longevity.
tastingNotes: Caramel, dried fruits, coffee, spice, incredible complexity and freshness
history: Ricardo Freitas revived Barbeito, focusing on quality. Single-cask releases from noble varieties.

name: Blandy's Vintage Malmsey Madeira
about: Historic Madeira producer since 1811. Malmsey is sweetest, richest style.
description: Historic Madeira producer since 1811. Malmsey is sweetest, richest style.
tastingNotes: Toffee, dried fruits, coffee, caramel, incredible richness and freshness
history: Blandy family in Madeira since 1811. Malmsey (Malvasia) is sweetest of four noble varieties.

name: Henriques & Henriques 20 Year Old Verdelho
about: Family producer since 1850 making authentic Madeiras. Verdelho is medium-dry style.
description: Family producer since 1850 making authentic Madeiras. Verdelho is medium-dry style.
tastingNotes: Smoke, orange peel, coffee, caramel, dried fruit, balanced sweetness
history: Henriques & Henriques founded 1850. Only Madeira producer owning vineyards. Verdelho is medium-dry.

name: Royal Tokaji Essencia
about: The most precious wine from Tokaj. Pure free-run juice from botrytized Furmint, incredibly rare.
description: The most precious wine from Tokaj. Pure free-run juice from botrytized Furmint, incredibly rare.
tastingNotes: Apricot, honey, orange marmalade, caramel, extraordinary concentration and acidity
pairings: or sipped alone as meditation wine
history: Essencia is tears from botrytized grapes under own weight. Takes decades to ferment to just 2-5% alcohol.
servingRecommendation: Serve at 10-12°C in small portions, traditionally on a spoon.

name: Kracher Trockenbeerenauslese
about: Austria's greatest sweet wine producer. Alois Kracher revolutionized Austrian dessert wines.
description: Austria's greatest sweet wine producer. Alois Kracher revolutionized Austrian dessert wines.
tastingNotes: Apricot, honey, exotic fruits, botrytis complexity, incredible concentration
history: Alois Kracher Sr. pioneered quality Austrian TBA. Son Gerhard continues tradition.
